mechanoreception.notes: As pelagic copepods, Diaptomidae likely rely on mechanoreceptors to detect water currents and vibrations for prey detection, predator avoidance, and mate finding. This is inferred from their general lifestyle as free-swimming crustaceans.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is likely important for food detection and mate recognition in Diaptomidae, as it is in many aquatic crustaceans.

vision.notes: The presence and capabilities of vision in Diaptomidae are not explicitly stated in the provided context. Further research is needed to determine the extent to which they use visual cues.
